column2: What!
column3: What!

column2: How is everything down on the earth?
column3: How is everything down on the earth?

column2: Well, he sat by his ice-cool fire and thought about his journey to the earth, and finally he decided the only way he could get there was to slide down a moonbeam.
column3: Well, he sat by his ice cool fire and thought about his journey to the earth, and finally he decided the only way he could get there was to slide down a moonbeam.

column2: But he plucked up courage and said to the farmer,
column3: But he plucked up courage and said to the farmer,

column2: Can you tell me the way to Norwich, sir?
column3: Can you tell me the way to Norwich, sir?

column2: A good-looking woman answered his knock at the door, and he asked politely,
column3: A good looking woman answered his knock at the door, and he asked politely,

column2: Is this the town of Norwich, madam?
column3: Is this the town of Norwich, madam?

column2: So he thanked her and entered the house, and she asked,
column3: So he thanked her and entered the house, and she asked,

column2: Matter! screamed the Man; "why, your porridge is so hot it has burned me."
column3: Matter! screamed the Man; "why, your porridge is so hot it has burned me."

column2: Come, come, no nonsense! said the magistrate, "you must have some name.
column3: Come, come, no nonsense! said the magistrate, "you must have some name.

column2: Who are you?"
column3: Who are you?"

column2: Very good, replied the judge; "now, then, where did you come from?"
column3: Very good, replied the judge; "now, then, where did you come from?"

column2: The moon.
column3: The moon.

column2: I slid down a moonbeam.
column3: I slid down a moonbeam.

column2: Indeed!	Indeed!
Well, what were you running for?"
column3: Well, what were you running for?"

column2: A woman gave me some cold pease porridge, and it burned my mouth.
column3: A woman gave me some cold pease porridge, and it burned my mouth.

column2: This person is evidently crazy; so take him to the lunatic asylum and keep him there.
column3: This person is evidently crazy; so take him to the lunatic asylum and keep him there.

column2: Therefore he begged the magistrate to wait a few minutes while he looked through his telescope to see if the Man in the Moon was there.
column3: Therefore he begged the magistrate to wait a few minutes while he looked through his telescope to see if the Man in the Moon was there.

column2: The nights are too hot."
column3: The nights are too hot."

column2: We can inflate this balloon and send the Man out of the Moon home in it."
column3: We can inflate this balloon and send the Man out of the Moon home in it."

column2: So the balloon was brought and inflated, and the Man got into the basket and gave the word to let go, and then the balloon mounted up into the sky in the direction of the moon.
column3: So the balloon was brought and inflated, and the Man got into the basket and gave the word to let go, and then the balloon mounted up into the sky in the direction of the moon.
